column2: An organization dedicated to cultivating young nobles.
The Grand Master of the Flower Knights.

column1: #For tooltip that require being a member

column2: Is a member of the Flower Knights.

column1: #Rank up decision if you made a custom one, alongside the required custom_local

column2: Besides the 108 weapons you can request a monk to enpower two: your bare hands and feet.

column1: #Tooltip of the decision in the society menu

column2: Contact a monk for a martial arts lesson.
As an officer it is only right you ride a horse.
Fetch a horse from the Flower Knight's stables.
As you make your path in high society you want to look radient.
Enquire for the finest powder, eyeliner and lipstick.
Summon the youth to form a Hwarang brigade.
All the lowest member's will be mobilized for combat.

You are told to travel to the Goose Forest and at your location to your suprise meet [hwarang_welcomer.GetTitledFirstName] who is a [From.GetSocietyRank]. He wanders with you asking you about poetry and various properties of the forest. Finally he asks if you would care to join the Hwarang?

You recieve a missive requesting you to journey, alone, to the Roster Forest. After a wrong turn you meet [hwarang_welcomer.GetTitledFirstName], his makeup making him resemble a forest animal. You keep waiting for the initiation test, yet no gangs of youths appear in your walk. At the end of a path he asks if you could join the Hwarang?

After recieving a letter you were given leave to the woodlands of the Half Moon Fortress. The chirps of insects drone as you climb a hill for initiation. At the top, fixing a woodern pole into the earth is [hwarang_welcomer.GetTitledFirstName]. He warns that if you join your first task is to carry his equipment down the hill.

You were told to meet [hwarang_welcomer.GetTitledFirstName], of [From.GetSocietyRank] rank, at the Duck Moat. You spot him and his reflection practicing marital arts with breathtaking grace. A mixture of awe and fear command your heart, you run up to him to make up for time gawking. Straight to the point, he asks if you would join the Hwarang?

You are dressed in the morning and to your suprise [hwarang_welcomer.GetTitledFirstName] is in the other room. Over some ground ginseng he suggests you go for a walk together, without your bodyguard. You agree and set off to Cistern Grove by foot, he introduces you to birds and trees as you tred a faint path. As you watch the city from above he

column1: #Name for a quest if there is no quest target

column2: Press the button and gain gold!
Press the button in the intrige menu.
You want to complete or fail the quest?
You are finally old enough to join the Hwarang. You've been thinking of enlisting since they staged that Taekwondo exhibition. [Root.Guardian.GetTitledFirstName] should be favorable.
Dear [Root.Guardian.GetTitledFirstName] I have decided I want to join the Hwarang and do good service for the country. Please accept this arrangement and I'll be forever grateful.
How about you become my personal aide?
[From.GetTitledFirstName] interupts your reading of the Three Scholarly Occupations and sits with you. [From.GetHeShe] has agreed to let you join the Hwarang and do good for your country.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] interupts your reading of the Three Scholarly Occupations and sits with you. [From.GetHeShe] has gently tells you joining the Hwarang puts you at unneccesary risk.
I'll steal his seal and join.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] interupts your reading of the Three Scholarly Occupations. While you can't be a Hwarang you definately could make a fine little assistant.
It transpires that [From.GetTitledFirstName] has joined the Flower Knights in secret!
[wounded_hwarang.GetTitledFirstName] is injured and it is my duty to help all Hwarangs! I will treat him to my best ability.
I'll make a mud cast with herbs embedded.
[FROM.GetTitledFirstName] has treated my wounded arm by making a mud-cast.
[FROM.GetTitledFirstName] has made me a sling and, while the pain throbs, at least there is no jolting pain.
It is reported [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] has healed his fellow Hwarang [From.GetTitledFirstName]. His skills are being put to good use
I don't want to hear more of this.

The local village of Son-Chu looks a heap, you ask a farmer if he needs help, whether with bandits or missing cats. He replies they have ate all the cats and need help with the harvest. You look at the clay-slated field and have an idea.

The local village of Sangwang looks a heap, you ask a farmer if he needs help, whether with bandits or missing cats. He replies they have ate all the cats and need help with the harvest. You look at the clay-slated field and have an idea.

The local village of Dolmudom looks a heap, you ask a farmer if he needs help, whether with bandits or missing cats. He replies they have ate all the cats and need help with the harvest. You look at the clay-slated field and have an idea.
You should pray to better dieties!
Maybe you should leave the area?
I should bring earthworms to help.
Your suggestion properly explained has a calming effect on the population. They agree they'll call a Mu-Dang from the Jeolla region next time who has better knowledge of the trinity's temperance.
It is wise to have a third opinion.
Perhaps being put on the spot gave you a bad hand, in any case the village don't look like they'll take your short handed response seriously.
A burley man identified as the local Mu-Dang's son takes offense to your comment. He demands "the fortunate" to apologize in front of the village.
Your defense of your position has been accepted. You even bowed to the elder. You return back to the chapter slightly shaken but not troubled.
Your defense of your position hasn't helped. He grabs you by the ear and throws you into the stables.

Your defense of your position: using citations, measured speech and courage impresses the Mu-Dang's son. He confesses he doesn't think his mother could make a knotted sacrifice doll, an elder agrees that this is probably their only option.

You whip out your sword so fast the man looks down startled at your expression. The farmer cries out "Good sir, let yourself not soil your silks against such turnip!". After much convincing you sheath and leave.
Maybe your strength is too weak but you were sure, wood doesn't block iron. You look up helpless as you are hit and faced with mud.

As you advance, the man draws out a dagger and you feel your balls tingle. You feel oddly incapable of moving forward, as he walks up to you, dodges your lame sword thrust and strikes you in the belly.

As you advance, the man draws out a dagger and you feel your balls tingle. You feel oddly incapable of moving forward, as he walks up to you, dodges your lame sword thrust and holds the blade to your throat. "I could cut you like a goat". He whispers. You give him a talesman and he lets you be free.

You run up to him and try to slice the idiot to ribbons. The sword misses and is stuck in a fence. He swings to hit you and slams you instead into the fence, smelling his unwashed breath. You knee him in the bullocks and he wails like winters wind. You then grab your sword and ask him to surrender forfeit.

You run up to him and try to slice the idiot to ribbons. The sword misses but leaves a scratch. He flees and you are ready to slide into his ribs, until a shout. A radient peasant girl runs into the muddy pitch and implores you to spare his life.
Tie this fool up in the stables.
May you meet in another karmic cycle.
After unsheaving your sword two other men appear. You all look reluctant to start fighting so you back off and get on your steed.
You approach him bare fighted and catch his lunge, throwing him off balance and delivering a kick that send him crashing into a fence. The sheep scatter and he doesn't seem eager to get up.
He approaches you and you rely on the open fist, you deflect his blows like in practice, then hit him in the forehead with an open palm. He staggers and a timely sweep has him disarmed.

The fight is long and drains you of much strength, fortunately your footwork lets you have open space to knee him in his chamber parts. His wheezing and betrayed expression is priceless as you peel him off you.

At the sight of a larger man approaching, you feel fear but your arms refuse to stop hitting him on he side of the head. [hwarang_grandmaster.GetTitledFirstName] would probably disapprove your footwork, yet his blooded mess leaves you with satisfaction. After calming down, you feel a tap and it is the farmer informing you he was drunk.

You wait for contact and are slammed into the dirty village fence. After a gut punch that makes you pause, you are granted respite by the Mu Dang's son being interupted by a lover to leave you alone. With his head turned you deliver an audiable punch, which lands him in pig-trail. After fighting off his beau you make to your horse.

After your first punch you realize, he too, is a martial artist. During a flurry of kicks and blocks you feel yourself slowing down, you are kicked into the mud when suddenly your horse shouts and gallops above you striking the commoner in the back. There is a groan from the collective peasantry as you make to your feet and, after calming, leave on your horse.

The man is fat and tries to use his size to throw you off. Using your knowledge of Ssuri you lure him to a muddy part of the field and use your lesser weight to throw blows. Suddenly you hear a cry and see a Moha trying to steal your horse

You approach him indicating your knuckle size when he takes two backflips to create space. He then whips his hands in a maze of formations and beckons you forward. You lunge at him and he blocks your punch and in a blur you are lying on the ground. You feel a warm feeling envelop you then you pass out.

Rage envelops you and you charge, straight into a fist. You block a few of his blows but remember you never really learnt offensive moves, only reactive defensive styles from the holy men. You fight a losing battle against his brute strength and after moving backwards you trip over. He stomps on you, but lets you go from limited respect.

You put your hands in fighting stance but this man wrestles. He seemingly absorbs you blows in his fat and throws you on the ground spraining your ankle, you almost feel something tear and cry "surrender, surrender!"..
You ask locals if they are aware of any quarries, you ride to each, finally you find a limestone deposit and transport the worms.

After doing a soil sample you make no progress, instead you focus on what is missing - worms! You ride from field to field asking if they know of any limestone deposits. It turns out there is one near Hen's creek. You ready a wagon and hire two farmhands for the day to shovel black earth.

You grin as you remember a limestone deposit on the way to the fields. You meet the prospective owner with his slaves and, after winning funds through turtle races, rent some slaves to help you dig the black, earthworm rich soil.

The locals were sceptical but after equating them to silk worms you manage to win over some of the more experienced farmers. They vow to transform the land through heavy concentrations of manure, earthworms and ash. You guidance and leadership is widely praised when you return.

There is amusement to your pinkish-black wagon of earth. Fortunately cooler heads prevail and you explain how despite the dung your nostrils noticed, there is not many worms in the area. You create enclosures and even if your inital idea doesn't work, at least it is fostering cooperation between the farmers.

After you transport the worms for many li, you are informed your idea is not original. This idea has been tried and the worms simply slithered off, you struggle to think of a way to solve the issue. By sun down you regretably concede defeat.

You gather the farmers and explain the duality between clay and sandy soil. Lacking paper they fail to take notes so you create sample soil in the pen: mixing dung, waste and ash in a pen. You demonstrate how worms snake their way to your soil rather than their soil. Due to the long time needed you convince [credits_baron.GetBestName] to cut their taxes for the next four years. Wanting to avoid lionisation, you praise the Grandmaster and gallop off.

You are seated around the fire with your chapter. You squish an ant trying to climb into your rice to the horror of your posse. [From.GetFirstName]! That could be someone's grandfather! You look at them and give many examples of how killing is helpful to society.

column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: While supervising a meet in nature between several young nobles, one member kills an insect that the rest swears is their maternial grandparent. An argument ensues where the [From.GetAgeYears] year old seems to make a point!

Dear [Root.GetFirstName], your lessons to your comrades earned merit in bringing to heel pompous Buddhists in the youth corps. Your lecture on the medical properties of Antlers was especially on point! Why should lives go to ruin because of "recarnation"?
Gain respect in the Hwarang leadership and prestige.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: Meditation is a key skill, but when I try to practice it my friends play pranks on me. I explain to them that meditation can make you beyond human. To prove it I extinguished my thoughts of everything and sure enough they couldn't feel my heart beat.

While supervising a caligraphy lesson, or more accurately preventing trouble,  [From.GetFirstName] assumes the lotus position and stops breathing. When he assures you he did not just return to life, you see how the teachings of Budda overweighs mere magic.

It is reported you have earned fame in bringing to heel those pagans in the youth corps. Congratulations for laying the proof that meditation lowers the heart beat to inaudiable, shattering superstitious facts in those factions.
Gain respect in the Hwarang leadership and prestige.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: You have been ordered to lead a group to Raven's mound to formulate poetry amid the dead bones. You decide to bring some blackberry wine so the words flow more naturally.
During a midnight meeting at Raven's mound, your superior [FROM.GetBestName] decides to break the rules and drink some blackberry wine. The inclusion in the hiddden makes a bond in the cold night.
During a discussion you mention that [Root.TopLiege.GetBestName]'s claim to be decended from Asoka is a farce.
[Hwarang_camp_superior.GetBestName], amongst others, looks troubled, but the next day doesn't seem to even remember going to a mound.
You wake up and try to remember last night. Then you remember, last night [From.GetFirstName] slandered the Wang!
A week later you earn a caning for your disparaging remarks towards the Phoenix Throne. Your skin around your ankles is all dead, or bleeding.

You are sleeping when you hear [FROM.GetFirstName] yelping in a pattern. The boys startle but remember he is to be punished for insulting our [root.topliege.GetTitle]'s name. Suddenly the crying stops.
Go see if he is alright.

A week later you earn a caning for your disparaging remarks towards the Phoenix Throne. After [GetAgeYears.TopLiege] strikes you hobble towards the dormitory. To your suprise [From.GetFirstName] is around the corner with some bandages.

You see [FROM.GetBestName] hobbling towards the dormitory, you becogn him stop and help him dress his wounds. You hear unexpected warmth in [FROM.GetFirstName]'s voice. You feel like you're going to be friends.
You aspy [FROM.GetBestName] hobbling towards the dormitory, you becogn him stop and help him dress his wounds. "I don't need your help!", he scowls.
[Hwarang_camp_superior.GetBestName], seems to have shared your opinion with the higher ups. They look stern at you, but likely you're excused from trouble because of age.

[From.GetBestName] marches into the monastary, like a man on a mission, and accuses his superior [FromFrom.GetTitledName] of insulting the bone rank system. He rattles off a long list of offenses he said, allegedly.
I will commend you to the [Root.TopLiege.GetTitle].

Apparently when you were serving the wine, you said something gravely offensive to the order of things. Perhaps something more honest about the rigid order than you intended to say. Some little rat was eager to tell and now you are in trouble!

A member of the Flower Knights, [camptraitorhwarang.GetBestName], was, apparently, too flowery in language in regards to the best men in the realm. One key insult was he said China would rule Korea better than you. This information came from a loyal servant, Pungsolju [From.GetFirstName] bows gravely.
Peace be upon you most worthy [Root.GetBestName], I have found your service most pleasing and permit you to break your studies to visit me in [From.Capital.GetName]

You are nervous as you meet your older sovereign. You have a walk through [Root.TopLiege.GetHerHis] vast garden as [Root.TopLiege.GetSheHe] inquires if the Hwarang has truly lost its marital edge. You reply to the contrary that you are always training for the next calamity, especially in these warlike times. At the end of the walk you are presented with a gift to treasure.

You wait for what seems years for your sovereign to leave the harem. You avoid watching the powdered beauties that walk out, their servants only distinguished by their lack of makeup. Suddenly you aspy [Root.TopLiege.GetBestName] approach you, personally, and grasping you by the hand presents you with a gift. [Root.TopLiege.GetHerHim] seems interested in hearing amusing episodes and you don't disappoint. "Ah, if only I was more carefree" is [Root.TopLiege.GetHerHis] reply as you bow adieu.

You are told by [Root.GetChancellorName] to wait for the sovereign, who is diligent to a fault. You stand, dripping makeup, when you see [Root.TopLiege.GetHerHis] excited strides, happy to make your acquaintance. You discuss the [Root.GetTemperature] amongst other mundane topics, although you are suprised at the [Root.TopLiege.GetTitle]'s knowledge of your ceremonies. At the end of the tête-à-tête You are given a box by [Root.GetTreasurerName] and told to open it at your home.

After you arrive, after being lost. You hear that the [Root.TopLiege.GetTitle] is out furfiling charity so you speak with [Root.TopLiege.Spouse.GetBestName]. You permit them to touch your makeup and explain how it is made of crushed centipede, after a suprisingly wholesome discussion you meet [Root.TopLiege.GetBestName] who after compliments to you both, present you, to the exaspiration of treasurer [Root.GetTreasurerName], with a gift from the palace.

You travel to the palace in [From.Capital.GetName] by horse. [Root.TopLiege.GetBestName] meets you on foot, which you quickly dismount and offer [Root.TopLiege.GetHerHim] the horse. [Root.TopLiege.SheHeCap] declines and you stroll along a blossoming path discussing the state of the Hwarang. You notice several times during your tales the [Root.TopLiege.GetTitle] would flinch and finally [Root.TopLiege.GetSheHe] turns to you and presses a gift into your hands. "Keep up the exemplary service".

You travel to the palace in [From.Capital.GetName]. [Root.TopLiege.GetBestName] looks in poor spirits but makes some time for you. As you and the [Root.TopLiege.GetTitle] walk through mossy hills and buddha statues, that look oddly like [Root.TopLiege.GetHerHis] ancestors, you feel your lively stories serve as a bright spot in their busy life. Finally [Root.GetMarshalName] manages to peel the sovereign from you. "Keep up the good work!" [Root.TopLiege.GetBestName] shouts as [Root.TopLiege.GetSheHe] leaves. Before you depart treasurer [Root.GetTreasurerName] hands you an elaborate gift.

You heart pounds even before you enter the palace gates. [Root.TopLiege.GetBestName] is surrounded with his court and you bow to let yourself be heard. The [Root.TopLiege.GetTitle] recounts the tale that led you to the throne, although with some embelishments. You are given a royal gift and informed you enjoy royal favour. After the spectacle, you meet several comrades attached to the palace worship and secretrat for daffodil tea and to admire your new heirloom.

While at the palace gates you run into [Wangdaughterhwarang.GetBestName] returning from a shrine outside [From.Capital.GetName]. After introducing yourself she looks doe-like at you, wanting to hear about your tales. You are half-way through a particularly entertaining tale when her music instructor interupts. As you ride off, reflecting on your day ... by [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]'s is she interested in you?
You consider improving her opinion of you.

Dear the [GetRootFromCompliment] [Root.GetBestName], I must confess to be enchanted by parade of favors granted since our fortunous meeting. While our meetings have been few, I find myself wondering as you travel in the thick wilderness what is the bearing of yourself. Please don't indulge in cruelties and write me frequently, lest we meet in this life or next.
You immediately develop a special bond.
Cast this missive into the camp flames.
Over liberal cups at a mound meeting, [Hwarang_camp_superior.GetBestName] mentions that the bone rank system of Silla becogns the actual talents to sail to China.
You have reported [Hwarang_camp_superior.GetBestName] to [From.GetBestName] as a disloyal subject. [From.GetBestName] just stares at you, "don't you know being a grass is a horrible virtue?"
You have reported [Hwarang_camp_superior.GetBestName] to [From.GetBestName] as a disloyal subject. [From.GetBestName] promises he will be lowered, and you ... raised by this incident.
You have reported [Hwarang_camp_superior.GetBestName] to [From.GetBestName] as a disloyal subject. [From.GetBestName] promises to mention this to the Wang.
Your [FROM.GetBestName] sings a foolish song and, following some stanzas, you all join in.
[FROM.GetBestName] shares some thoughts about berry bushes and mushrooms. It didn't seem the group was informed so it was enlightening.

Over blackberry wine you discuss in no certain way how you would overcome a hypothetical tiger attack. After [From.GetFirstName] declares they'd spear the beast, [FromFrom.GetBestName makes a lifelike immitation of a tiger. You look to see if you're the only one who soiled themselvese .
Go into the forest with the tigers and bears ... fortunately your fragrance masks the odor

column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.
column28: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: It is reported you have earned fame in bringing to heel those pagans in the youth corps. Congratulations for laying the proof that meditation lowers the heart beat to inaudiable, shattering superstitious facts in those factions.
Gain respect in the Hwarang leadership and prestige.
column3: Je pense que je pouve comprendre.

column2: You've got together [hwarang_friend.GetFirstName] from Hwarang and decided to lock the roads to loose banditry. After some uneventful compliments you finally meet a family being accosted by bandits. You think fast.

You pull out your weapons and when they alert there is a loud clamour. In the struggle you slay a few but fail to pursue because [hwarang_friend.GetFirstName] is wounded. The family is dressing his wounds.
It is reported, over Chuseok, [From.GetFirstName] has been wounded. Him and his closest friends covered a twenty mile highway and met some dangerous bandits.
It is reported [From.GetFirstName] has beat up robbers preying on travelers during Chuseok. Him and his closest friends covered a twenty mile highway and earned much thanks.
So that is why he disappeared.

In your travels around the province, you've had the mispleasure of constantly meeting a troublesome Mu and her ilk. She would demand you be her bodyguards, while she made her rounds. Me and [hwarang_friend.GetFirstName] look at each other, this night you're posted outside the house of a well known merchant.
Creep up and spy on her.

Slowly, slowly you move to the side of the building and listen next to the window screen. "If I sell this junk to the rabble, I want my half." She sternly warns him. "Without my words this acorn powder is useless." He agrees after an increasingly loud argument. You stare at [hwarang_friend.GetFirstName].

It is reported [hwarang_friend.GetFirstName] and [From.GetFirstName] have uncovered corrupt Mu witch doctors in your demesne who have robbed peasants blind. Together they brought these hounds to justice.
Tell him to bring the gold to me.

You are touring with [hwarang_friend.GetFirstName] and [hwarang_friend_two.GetFirstName] behind your back. You decide to go off road and stumble across a graveyard you didn't know existed. Suddenly you hear scruffling behind the piles of earth and rocks.

[hwarang_friend.GetFirstName] goes first and finds dirty children covered in soil. They present a rather stark imagine to your powdered up selves. It is clear they are gravediggers, but they refuse to admit that let alone their boss.

It is reported [From.GetFirstName] has broken up gangs of boys who dig up ancestorial graves. His closest friends tickled the boys with their feathers until they gave up their ringleader. The swine is in your jail right now.
Bring back the valuables, they are of no use to the dead.
That is a form of torture. Bring him to me.

You march around the countryside, never failing to help the weak and serve the realm. You marvel at the new things you can do that yesterday was farfetched, hard stares becoming grins. You only wish you could do more.

It is reported [From.GetFirstName] has quelled the opposition to your rule. He marched around the countryside handing out Hangwa to children and helping elderly mothers chop wood. He only praised your name.
Ginseng would make the perfect gift.

You always thought you were handsome, but apparently the girls agree. It is amazing how silly girls get when they are in love, it is like they are in silent competition to rise above their station. Doubtless I've taken advantage of this to do my duty as a flowering knight.
I need to leave these wretches alone.

It is rumoured Youth Captain [From.GetFirstName] has earned himself many female followers on part of his good looks. They vary in age and often carry carvings of him. The oldest have been rumoured to share his quarters.
Ginseng would make the perfect gift.
[hwarang_friend.GetFirstName] and [hwarang_friend_two.GetFirstName] implore you to avoid one girl. She had spent an evening with both of them in order to be yours exlusively.
We avoid that area from now on!
It is rumoured [From.GetFirstName] has earned himself many female followers on part of his prestige. They pay respects to his friends only to get closer to him.
Ginseng would make the perfect gift.
You remember the humilating rituals you had to partake when you joined the Hwarang. You've thought of a new one that is so humiliating, it definately would seal recruits into a secret brotherhood.
Make them walk over hot coals.
Make them dress you up and apply make up.
Make them swear temporary slavery to you.

It is rumoured [From.GetFirstName] has developed a ritual for new partakers where his friends use them in indiscreet manners. It is not known what part they take or who, but the rumour is swelling in the markets.
As long has he isn't on the recieving end.
Ginseng would make the perfect gift..
Send him a letter stressing discresion.
You don't look at [From.GetFirstName] before he is sat down by your soldiers.
This makes a mockery of the Hwarang. I will fine you.
He tells you the rumour started by peasant young girls who he rejected because he was arresting an handsome criminal.
It is fine to have a male lover. But was there violence?
So you found him handsome too!.
He tells you the rumour was started by street orchins who he arrested for pick-pocketing.
Now you know the power of gossip!
It is fine to have a male lover. But was there coercion?
No elder teacher! He replies. "I did neither."
No elder teacher! He replies. "I did not rape."
The crime here is your homosexuality..
Yes elder teacher! He replies. "Us, the flowering knights, all are involved."
I believe you are going to remain here, until someone wants you.
I am going to castrate you as an example.
I am going to let you off.
Kill me now! He replies. You waver and before you can do anything he stabs himself in the chest with a dagger.
Leave him to bleed in his cell.
You robbed me of a rare pleasure.
When [From.GetFirstName] recovers he asks why he is not in jail
Your comrade in the Hwarang likes to put perfume on his body. He claims it makes him successful.
Your comrade in the Hwarang likes to wear make up. He claims it makes him attractive.

The grandmaster appears for a suprise inspection. You stop playing polo and line up according to rank. He notices you and asks you a question: When taking a life should you do it plain sight or in the shadows?

All you lads are up early because your Wonhwa is coming to check on you. You clear up your dormitary as [hwarang_friend_two.GetFirstName] desperately washes the rice pot. You've never seen her, but some say she is most fair.

The morning is cold and wet but your beating hearts stir as her carriage arrives and a lady steps out. She is very wrinkled and scarred, a few boys make disapointed comments. "Hwarang!", she announces. "Ye" you boom, looking to the grass. "It is my pleasure to announce an inter-chapter fighting competition, held in a weeks time. You should prepare for yourself and your comrades."

You are prepared for the fight of your life. The winner is the boy who can take down the most boys, with an extra point for the last man standing. [Liege.GetTitle] watches eagerly as you prepare yourself against your opponent.
Your kick is caught and you're swept to the ground and kicked.
Your kick is fast enough to prevent a block. The boy is sent flying back and gets up winded.
Your kick is not fast enough and is blocked. [pighter_one.GetFirstName] tries to sweep you but fails.
Your kick strikes [pighter_one.GetFirstName]. He seemed to retaliate but couldn't finish
Your punch is blocked and you're swept to the ground like a rattlesnake. You feel a punch in your ribcage as you leap up.
Your lightning punch smashes against him before he can put up his block.
Your punch is not swift and is averted. [pighter_one.GetFirstName] tries to sweep you but fails.
Your punch strikes [pighter_one.GetFirstName]. He seemed to try a punch but couldn't finish.
Your opponent kicks, but you catch the leg and sweep the boy to the ground. You have the next move.
A blur and shooting pain is your reward. You crawl up, but you're not sure you can keep going.
You easily block the kick, but fail to sweep your opponent. You feel foolish but have the momentum.
You are struck by a kick that hurts but doesn't stop you from throwing a punch in return. The problem is your opponent ducks.
Your opponent throws a hit, but sidestepping, you catch the leg and sweep the boy to the ground. You have the next move.
A blur and shooting pain is your reward. You crawl up, you're not sure you can keep going.
You easily block the punch, but fail to sweep your opponent. You feel foolish but have the momentum.
You are struck by a knuckle that hurts but doesn't stop you from throwing a punch in return. The problem is your opponent ducks.
You have lost. You feel sore but bow to [Liege.GetTitle] and retreat to the sidelines to lick your wounds. All attention has switched to the victor.
[Liege.GetTitledFirstName] and the royal family clap politely as you bow to your opponent and ruler. You try to prepare yourself mentally as the Wang laughs merrily.
[Liege.GetTitledFirstName] and the royal family look intrigued as you defeat [FROM.GetFullName]. You do feel like your in the middle of a battle.
There is a round of applause as [FROM.GetFullName] collapses. You are unsure you can recover but you feel a need to win.
[FROM.GetFullName] collapses and you help him to his feet to bow to the [Liege.GetTitle]. The physcian investigates [FROM.GetFirstName] and your given a little break, to not break your streak.
I am a little lucky today
[Liege.GetTitledFirstName] drops a rice-ball as you beat your fifth successive opponent. He asks your family's name and you reply. He bestows honour to your house.
You notice the incoming Hwarangs looking nervous as you face them with a bow. You smile to a beaming [Liege.GetTitle] as you prepare to make short work of your opponent.
After dispatching your seventh you feel ready to collapse. [Liege.GetTitledFirstName] motions to you and says he will grant you a wish.
I want nothing but to serve sire.

[hwarang_winner.GetTitledFirstName] is the last man standing and the real winner of the event is [hwarang_overall_winner_target.GetTitledFirstName]. You wish them the very best and implore them to continue protecting the commoners
Dearest [Root.GetTitledFirstName], cultivation is the essence. I suggest you briskly head to the wilderness and spread the fruits of your studies. It may also benefit you to bring company.
Oh dear, I got the flu.
I have a purse for you.
While riding through an unfamilar forest you aspy six or seven Mohe outcasts butchering illegally and cutting down spindle trees.
Prepare a raid with the authorities.
You bustle through the bushes and cry come on men! The startled Mohe flee in all directions leaving you with choice barbeque.

Your horse flails as you burst from the underbrush. The Jurgens are suprised but manage to surround you and pull you off your horse. "Looks like horse meat will also be offered." calls a Mohe in his pigskin cap. "We can butcher that one too".

You are about to move when a Mohe snuffles, "you smell that?" He exclaimed, "fragrance! The Hwarang are upon us boys! Oh Goddess of the skies!" The gang splits into groups of two and flees. You gallop after two of them. One stumbles over so you tie him up, and bring him to the local lord. You return latter for the meat and find it has all been eaten by some furry beast

You are about to move when a Mohe snuffles, "you smell that?" He exclaimed, "fragrance! The Hwarang are upon us boys! Oh Goddess of the skies!" The gang splits into groups of two and flees. You gallop after two of them, but remember your last oath, so you shoot both in the legs and take the scenic route home with your cargo. You return latter for the meat but your horse refuses to go further into the forest. You turn back.

You are about to pounce when you notice your comrade [hwarang_forest_comrade.GetBestName]. You give a hand signal, you both dismount and creep closer. [hwarang_forest_comrade.GetBestName] pulls out a knife but fortunately only holds it to a Jurgen neck. Fortunately it was the leader, judging by the dog fur cap "Drop everything and come with us to your trial", you state. The band seeing no way out is tied up and, later, given 50 strokes each.

You charge out sword swinging and in your bloodlust slice open a Mohe bow maker. You get surrender from two trembling youths and bring them to the local magistrate for questioning. You expected a reward for shattering a criminal enterprise, but it seems the entire community thinks elsewise. You have recieved a reprimand from [FROM.GetBestName] for taking a life so carelessly.
You charge out sword swinging your horse falls to the forest floor crippled. You are thrown into the bushes and your sword goes flying.

After a chase, that ran too close for your liking, you return to your chapter and explain what happened. They vow to increase patrols to the air so hopefully these crooks will be caught by more experienced trackers.

You show your bare fists and the Mohe, fond of physical pursuits, shelth their weapons and engage. You grit your teeth as you use the fire to even the numbers by fighting them one by one, each victory making them more eager to prove their worth. After sending one rolling off the fire, you hear a whistle of an arrow which plants on a crate to your left. You rush to the assailant and deliver a kick that breaks a rib. You threaten to break his neck unless they scatter, cautious of arrows you sling him onto your horse and ride off.

Quietly you trot back and tie your horse to a pine tree. You creep and climb a nearby tree, close enough to observe the group. You cannot but admire the efficency of the slaughter as they finish as the sun wavers in the sky. Next they start converting the wood into bows with pigskin leather cases.
You have been sent to a remote part of the Diamond mountains. The air is dense with moisture. You cry out and hear your echoes amid the magpies. You are on a mission.
The rain pours down on your felt hat, the open space of the mountains loom as you remember your mission. You spot the bend of Catfush brook and aquiant yourself in preparation for your mission.

You recieved the missive yesterday, underneath the stone postbox. Your horse gives a start, it is as if at the closure of your ride it smells hostility. You read again your mission, that led you into the Silver mountains.

Half a week ago, you didnt predict you'd be perched on a make-shaft raft making its way into the mountains. But so is fate. You pay your pilot, who refuses to accet leaving you alone with a drenched, annotated map.
You have been summoned into the mountains on a very important mission. Only a handful are to know about the sensitive issue you must fix.
A secret ginseng field owned by the [Root.TopLiege.GetTitle] is being tapped into. These parts are remote so it is up to you to intercept the bandit and make them an example to posterity.
See if you can not capture them unaware.
Trace this criminal to their home.
Place the mark of the Hwarang.
Trust the influence of your society to scare them away.
You wait and see, munching on some rice cakes you thoughtfully bought. While gazing at the black tortoise star you hear frantic digging.
See if you can not capture them unaware.
You rush to the shadowy figure and sweep their befuddled form onto the soil. They are swiftly disarmed and, after presenting your dagger, tied up.
You rush forward and in the pitch blackness trip over a wild dog. Fortunately the beast was just as shocked and runs away yipping.
You rush forward and in the pitch blackness trip over a wild racoon. It lets out a loud yell and you hear running close by.

You run and with honed instinct avoid the pitfalls your stumbling vagrant makes. After a quarter of a Li you close in on him and tackle him from behind to his fear. "Oh noble Hwarang, I am merely stealing to feed my infants", he cries.
You take pity on the crook.
Half a moon later, on your return to [Root.TopLiege.Capital.GetName], you are summoned to explain why ginseng keeps disappearing from the Royal Mountain Reserve.
The criminals are merely poor people.
Hope that they will forgive your incompetance.
Explain about nature's lesser known rodant.

A Hwarang with the name of [From.GetBestName] has failed a mission to protect your royal ginseng planted in the mountains. Their reason, when pressed, was that the common people of the region are poverty striken and deserve relief.
You abandon the royal plot and give it to the poor.
Escort this fool to the dungeons.
As you explain you see lines of compassion fold on [Root.TopLiege.GetTitledName]. "I have decided to give this land to enrich the local villages". You leave, sure of your good karma.
Your standing in the Hwarang improves, as well as [Root.TopLiege.GetTitledName]'s opinion of you.
You explain and the [Root.TopLiege.GetTitle] seems disappointed but not suprised. Let us talk no more of this issue, after a few social niceties you bow and depart.
You are content about a job well done, word may spread of your deeds.
Arrest this imbecile the [Root.TopLiege.GetTitle] calls and from behind two guards grab you and drag you off to the cells.
Whether you are a suspect or victim, you are detained in jail.
